column1: In 1937 foreigners were told to leave and Magnitogorsk was declared a closed city. There is little reliable information about events and development of the city during the closed period.

The city played an important role during World War II because it supplied much of the steel for the Soviet war effort and its strategic location east of the Ural Mountains made Magnitogorsk safe from seizure by the German Army.
